lines.text: There is nothing more like eternity than a train ride of eleven days, unless it's two people and a ham.
Oh, I'm sure he's split a rail or two in his youth, but he's been a lawyer and a politician ever since. Don't underestimate him
Mr. Lincoln, I'm a life-long republican from Duchess County.
Life long? But our party is only six years old!
That's right, life long!
I made my choice on many things when I choose Mr. Lincoln.
Real war is not for boys, Tad, not that this is going to be a real war.
To run away when someone is shooting guns at you is a sensible reaction, I think it would be my own.
Faced with a battery of guns, I might find myself some nice tree to rest behind.
Do you know what this is, Brother Washburne?
The Army of the Potomac.
No, it is General MacClellen's bodyguard!
I know politicians, they don't care how grotesque they are, as long as everyone notices them, like the freaks in Mr. Barnum's Museum.

[about Edward Everett's speech]
My God! The man will speak for three hours before I even get to my feet, so I have prepared a short, short speech.
[Gettysburg Address]
Molly, if there was any danger to an officer on a generals staff at all, they'd call off the war.
Replace him!
[MacClellen]
With who?
Anybody!
That's the problem, Molly, I can't have anybody, I must have somebody.
I can make a general any time, but horse costs the government 125 dollars
I like Grant, he takes what we give him, and he doesn't ask for the moon.
There is talk of you running for President.
Don't want the job. Tell the President he has nothing to fear from me.
Well, I do have a certain political ambition after the war, if I survive. I mean to run for mayor of Galena, and if I win, I mean to have the sidewalk fixed up between my house and the depot.
The problem is not my getting killed, Ward, I expect I shall some day. There is no way to stop it. What I fear is being captured by rebels and held for ransom.
How much do you think the rebels would ask for you?

It's not how much, it's how many. They want their prisoners of war back. One ugly President swapped for a 100,000 soldiers would be very tempting to 'ol Jeff Davis. You see, sooner or later they will run out of men and we won't. And that's how we'll win.
